data.title: Atomic Chess Explosions
data.solution:
board = []
8.times do
    row = gets.chomp
    board << row
end
attacker = gets.chomp
target = gets.chomp
a, t = [attacker, target].map{|xy| [ xy[0].ord - 97, xy[1].to_i - 1 ] }
x, y = a
X, Y = t
board[~y][x] = "."  # Attacker dies
board[~Y][X] = "."  # Target dies
f = -> n { n.clamp(0,7) }
blast_zone = [*f[Y-1]..f[Y+1]].product([*f[X-1]..f[X+1]])
blast_zone.map{ board[~_1][_2] = board[~_1][_2].tr("^Pp", ".") } # Non-pawns in blast zone die
puts board
data.statement:
In the game of {{Atomic Chess}}, the pieces and board (8x8) are the same as chess, but when a piece is attacked it sets off <<a 3x3 explosion>> around that square, killing <<the attacker>>, <<the target>> and <<any non-pawns in the 3x3 surroundings>> (of the [[target]]'s co-ordinates).

You are given an 8x8 chess board in the form of 8 [[row]]s of 8 characters consisting of {{KQBNRP}} (King, Queen, Bishop, Knight, Rook, Pawn) for white pieces and {{kqbnrp}} for black pieces, with '{{.}}'s for empty squares.

After this you are given two chess co-ordinates in the form {{[a-h][1-8]}} (e.g. '{{c5}}'). The first is the co-ordinates of the piece that is attacking ([[attacker]]) and the second is the co-ordinates of the square being attacked ([[target]]).

<<Print the board after the explosion, with all exploded pieces replaced with '{{.}}'.>>

The top left corner is always {{a8}}. The bottom right is {{h1}}. {{a-h}} is for columns, {{1-8}} is for rows (counts from bottom row up, top is 8).
data.constraints:
No 'en passant' captures in any test cases: explosions will always be centred around the [[target]] piece's co-ordinates.
Always 8x8 board. 1 < {{# Pieces}} < 17

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In the game of Atomic Chess, the pieces and board (8x8) are the same as chess, but when a piece is attacked it sets off a 3x3 explosion around that square, killing the attacker, the target and any non-pawns in the 3x3 surroundings (of the target's co-ordinates).

You are given an 8x8 chess board in the form of 8 rows of 8 characters consisting of KQBNRP (King, Queen, Bishop, Knight, Rook, Pawn) for white pieces and kqbnrp for black pieces, with '.'s for empty squares.

After this you are given two chess co-ordinates in the form [a-h][1-8] (e.g. 'c5'). The first is the co-ordinates of the piece that is attacking (attacker) and the second is the co-ordinates of the square being attacked (target).

Print the board after the explosion, with all exploded pieces replaced with '.'.

The top left corner is always a8. The bottom right is h1. a-h is for columns, 1-8 is for rows (counts from bottom row up, top is 8).
Input
8 Lines : A string of 8 characters each representing one row of the initial chess board.
Next Line : The chess co-ordinates of the attacker
Next Line : The chess co-ordinates of the target
Output
8 Lines : A string of 8 characters each representing one row of the final chess board.
Constraints
No 'en passant' captures in any test cases: explosions will always be centred around the target piece's co-ordinates.
Always 8x8 board. 1 < # Pieces < 17
Example
Input
........
........
........
..k.....
..b.b..p
........
........
..Q....K
c1
c4
Output
........
........
........
........
....b..p
........
........
.......K
